title: Formal Model for Semantic-Driven Service Execution
segmentation: Hi everybody, my name is Thomas footballer.
I'm from semantic technology institutes in Innsbruck at the University of Innsbruck.
And I will present the work that we have done together with.
My check number from the legal way and Adrian Markham from our Institute.
So this work is about execution model for semantic driven service.
Execution.
So first I will talk about the motivation, little bit and also I will explain the motivation scenario that we use in our work.
Then I will talk a little bit about the background.
Concepts that we use in our work.
So that's basically the semantic web services and related things.
Then I will explain our model.
And finally I will.
Talk about the implementation.
Formal.
So in short, the motivation general motivation of the semantic Web services is to automate the service usage.
So basically we distinguish two phases and the service integration process.
So the first one is called late binding when we want to perform tasks like service discovery.
Service selection composition remediation.
And once we find the matching between the user request and potential services, the things that can fulfill this request, we need to perform the execution.
So this work is actually about the second phase, which is the service execution.
So we assume that the light binding or the binding between the service request and the service provider has been finished.
So in general, if you want to integrate services today, we usually have to do quite a lot of manual work.
And typically used in device work folks for that.
Like for example people or whatever technology available in the SOA technology.
So what we propose is to use the semantic service descriptions and perform the semantic service integration.
Semantic web services provide more expressivity that the existing technologies.
And also we want to apply do major tasks within the service integration and in particular within the execution which is the data mediation and process mediation.
So let me just first go through the motivations scenario for work so this scenario comes from the semantic Web Services challenge.
That's the initiative, which is driven by so semantically Constitues University of Tran Stanford.
Angenor University and Orrick is actually here, so if you are interested in hearing about this challenge, you can talk to him.
And apart from organizing the challenge, we also contributes to the challenge with our solution.
And one of those scenarios that are defined by by the semantic Web Services Challenge is called mediation scenario.
And this is exactly what is here.
So this scenario talks about two companies.
They want to engage in the business to business integration.
It's on the left hand side.
We have a blue company and on the right hand side we have a moving company.
So the book company using.
It'll sit down in system.
For purchase orders and the Moon Company does not use restaurants, they have some proprietary back end systems like customer relationship management and all the management systems.
Or these are systems relevant for the problem that we are target.
So what happens is that if the Bloom Company sends the purchase of the request so the blue Company sends the request in one message, including.
It's ID as well as all the items that the company wants to order and expects to receive paper purchase order confirmation.
On the other hand, if the Moon Company wants to process this request, it must perform a couple of interactions within its back end systems.
So we have the first interaction with the customer relation management system.
That basically you first need to find the internal customer ID.
And only after that we can start.
We can open the order at all items to be ordered into the order and closed the order and only after that we can generate purchase order conf.
So there are two types of interoperability problems.
The first one is the data interoperability becausw the Blue Company using Rosetta net standard.

Which defines a messages structures and the Moon company using some proprietary formats, which is dependent on the back end systems they are using and the second type of the interoperability is the process in the interoperability.

It's resonant system, but on the other hand there are a couple of other interactions.

Needs to solve.

I mean both are important.

Using so in particular it is the web service technology.

The second concept that we use in the work is the data mediation and the last one is the process mediation.

So enjoy.
Total if we want to describe services at the semantic level.
The basically distinguish four types of semantic descriptions, so the first one is the ontology, which is the information model that the service uses for the input and output messages.
Then the second type of the description is the behavior description and I mean we distinguish in our framework two types of behavior.
One is called choreography, which is basically a protocol describing how we can interact with the service.
And how a client needs to interact with the service in order to consume the service functionality and the other type of behavior with the orchestration.
So how the function of the service is composed out of other services which is not relevant for this work?
So it's not even mentioned here.

We don't use them here because they are useful for discovery, for example composition.

Details here.

It's quite obvious as well, so we have two parts we have design time determination.
We have two ontologies.

We define the mappings between them and then we have runtime, which means that if you want to transform during runtime, one message to another message, we apply those mappings and execute those mappings and we transfer.
Messages.
The last concept which is.
Important is the process mediation and there is some work defining the different process mediation patterns.
So in this case we have one button which basically says that if one partner is sending 2 messages, which is not really requested by the other partner, the process major must stop that message.
The other button says that if these messages are sent in different order, the process mediator must adjust that order according to the expectations of the other business partner.

But if one partner sending the message.
That needs to be split into two different interactions and.

So these are like really conceptual specification of all possible patterns during the process medication and our model.

Three major steps and during the execution, so the first step is the processing of the choreography.

Again, we apply the processing of the during the execution of the choreography.
This order will be adjusted automatically.

Modeling of ontologies as well As for the specification of the mappings between ontologies.
That generates the mapping rules.
Then in turn are used during the execution and then we have this middleware system called this mix.
In the middle of system that contains all kinds of different components that.
Correspond to the service use tasks that we want to apply within both phases, like binding as well as execution.

But what we implemented in this environment is the execution of the services according to the execution model that I have just present.
As I said at the beginning.

So this is the solution architecture.
Of the overall solution.
So as I said, we have also done IT system which is available as a web service.

On the other hand we have the Moon company with back end systems.

So the conclusion?
What we have done is the we have defined the execution model as well as its implementation that combines tasks.
The data improves this mediation that builds on the description of the semantic Web services.
What is possible to do with this is that.
For certain types of scenarios, we don't need to have this centralized workflow, so we can.
We're able to model the services independently.
Their descriptions and then can use the execution engine, the middleware business middleware with diploid execution engine to execute those services and track the conversation between those services.
And one thing is that we assume that the choreographies are compatible.
That means that we can basically handle the four process mediation patterns by adjusting the order of the messages or splitting or combining the messages.

That basically means that the process medication must be possible, but there could be cases where the process medication might not be really possible, and for that we would need some additional work and this is our future regularly plan to do.
And we have also evaluated our solution in the semantic Web Services challenge.
In the Sheriff and basically there is one question.
As part of this evaluation, how the solution needs to be adjusted when changes occur in back end systems?

Whether there must be changes done in the implementation or whether the changes are sufficient for the description of the services and we have proven that we can just adjust the description of the services in order to facilitate the changes in back end systems.
I mean, at the beginning we had some problems with implementation, so we had to make some.
